5.19.17  6:35 am   You wrote that you try to make every video your favourite in the time of making it. You've also said in one of your reality videos (back in 2013 though) that you try not to let perfectionism get the better of you, that "it's not the point". 5.19.17  6:29 am   How do you think living a "normal life" would affect who you are? Or who you were if you had lived that kind of life all the time? I hate to use the word "normal", but in this case I use it to describe life where one has a mediocre job, a relationship, spends freetime with different hobbies such as sports or hanging out with friends. Could you be like that?

5.18.17  9:22 pm   Been watchin' hotewig everyday as promised. Decided to focus solely on the score without quoting lines or singing along to jingles (the new arrivals one and the Turkey one almost got me). The question: How did you get so skilled in matching sounds to visual actions? The sounds you pick for zooming, panning, an empire expanding, a picture getting smaller, even an arrow being drawn are so precise and perfect every time. Have you always just heard sounds accompanying non-auditory actions in your head? Or did you learn it from somewhere like watching cartoons, for example, which tend to do that a lot?
